turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of the Royal Marines.
turn.1: What were the main changes in the Royal Marines during the 20th century?
turn.2: The abandonment of the Marine's artillery role meant that the Corps would subsequently have to rely on Royal Artillery support when ashore, that the title of Royal Marines would apply to the entire Corps and that only a few specialists would now receive gunnery training.
turn.4: As a form of consolation the dark blue and red uniform of the Royal Marine Artillery now became the full dress of the entire Corps.
turn.5: Did the corps wear any other uniforms?
turn.6: Royal Marine officers and SNCO's however continue to wear the historic scarlet in mess dress to the present day.
turn.7: Did the corps have any other titles?
turn.8: The ranks of Private, used by the RMLI, and Gunner, used by the RMA, were abolished and replaced by the rank of Marine.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: During the Second World War, a small party of Royal Marines were first ashore at Namsos in April 1940, seizing the approaches to the Norwegian town preparatory to a landing by the British Army two days later.
turn.11: Did they face any other hardships?
turn.12: The Royal Marines formed the Royal Marines Division as an amphibiously trained division, parts of which served at Dakar and in the capture of Madagascar.
